DATAPATH = Path.cwd().parent/'data'

We want a convenience method for plotting 2 Series together:

plot2series[source]

plot2series(s1:Series, s2:Series, names:Optional[str]=None, y_label='y', nrows=1, ncols=1, sharex=False, sharey=False, squeeze=True, subplot_kw=None, gridspec_kw=None)

Plots 2 Series against each other

s1 = df.ghi['Jul 2019']
s2 = s1+100*np.random.uniform(size=s1.shape)
ax = plot2series(s1, s2, figsize=(10,6))

Some code found on the internet to put the value over the top of the bars...

add_value_labels[source]

add_value_labels(ax, labels=None, spacing=5)

Add labels to the end of each bar in a bar chart.

Arguments: ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes): The matplotlib object containing the axes of the plot to annotate. spacing (int): The distance between the labels and the bars.

plot_yearly_gain[source]

plot_yearly_gain(s1:Series, s2:Series, labels=None)

Plot bar chart with gain percentage

Let's generate some gained data:

s1 = monthly(df.ghi)/1000  #KW
s2 = s1+10*np.random.uniform(size=s1.shape)

pd.concat([s1, s2], axis=1)
